headline: AI will 'amplify, not replace' human performance: Workday CEO
summary: Business management platform Workday (WDAY) is launching its own digital toolbox of AI models that will help boost businesses' productivity by automating and streamlining contracts, sales agreements, and various other features. Workday CEO Carl Eschenbach sits down with Market Catalysts host Julie Hyman and Yahoo Finance executive editor Brian Sozzi to discuss Workday's investment into AI for productivity purposes, especially after the company laid off nearly 1,800 at the start of 2025 as part of its restructuring. Catch Yahoo Finance's full interview with Workday CEO Carl Eschenbach. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

content.title: AI will 'amplify, not replace' human performance: Workday CEO
content.description:
Business management platform Workday (WDAY) is launching its own digital toolbox of AI models that will help boost businesses' productivity by automating and streamlining contracts, sales agreements, and various other features.

Workday CEO Carl Eschenbach sits down with Market Catalysts host Julie Hyman and Yahoo Finance executive editor Brian Sozzi to discuss Workday's investment into AI for productivity purposes, especially after the company laid off nearly 1,800 at the start of 2025 as part of its restructuring.

Catch Yahoo Finance's full interview with Workday CEO Carl Eschenbach.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out moreÂ Market Catalysts.
